Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of NIR Image-Guided Lymphatic Mapping in Esophageal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either Indocyanine Green (ICG) alone or ICG pre-mixed with human serum albumin (ICG:HSA)

Participants.evidence: 10 patients with resectable esophageal adenocarcinoma at a single surgical center

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either Indocyanine Green (ICG) alone or ICG pre-mixed with human serum albumin (ICG:HSA)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the safety and feasibility of intraoperative, minimally invasive near-infrared (NIR) image-guided lymphatic mapping in esophageal cancer patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the identification of regional lymph nodes (LNs) within the surgical field, assessed intraoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved through a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on a per-protocol basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: NIR imaging successfully identified NIR+ regional LNs in 6 out of 9 patients, with 2–6 LNs detected per patient

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the intervention were reported
